text.p: Investors should hold shares of Polish confectionery E Wedel Zaklady Przemyslu Cukierniczego SA (Wedel), as significant salty snack profits were unlikely to flow in before 1998, Nomura Equity Research said in a report.
Nomura said that through current marketing and distribution costs Wedel had laid the foundations to enjoy salty snack gross margins 50 percent above group average.

"We believe that it will not be until 1998 before salty snacks will make a significant contribution to operating profits and Wedel's group profits will start to grow strongly," the report dated September 19 said. @
Since then Wedel has fallen on the Warsaw bourse's main market to 150 zlotys from 153 zlotys.
Nomura predicted that Wedel's pre-tax profits would grow to 49 million zlotys this year, 55 million next year and 77 million in 1998 from 48.5 million last year.
Its price-earnings ratio would be at 34 this year, 30.6 next year and 21.6 in 1998 compared with 26.8 last year.
Nomura said competitive market conditions as well as the heavy investments would keep profits flat this year and allow only 13-percent growth next year. @
